customer_reviews.title: Great!, then after a year stops working.  Anker used to be high quality, not anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of Anker for years, but I have to say this hub is a really big disappointment. Considering what I paid for this a year or so ago, I was amazed at how it just stopped working completely after a short time. It just fails, first, the "IQ" ports stop charging, then the other posts give up the ghost as well. Sad, as I had really hoped to continue to buy a quality product. I had raved about them in the past, but with this simple item failing in a year, I have to say they will not be getting any free advertising from this ex-fan.

Cheap $7 hub works great for same scenario; this Anker hub produces intermittent communication. Simply useless. I tried providing this feedback directly to vendor, but I did not get a reply.

customer_reviews.title: To connect an external hard drive, wire keyboard, ...
customer_reviews.text: To connect an external hard drive, wire keyboard, Logitech mouse receiver and laptop cooler usb power, I bought this. Pros, Design is very solid and simple Additional power source(adapter) provides putting more than 4 usb-based devices. Reduce power loads on my laptop. Led light indicates what ports are used as a data source or not (e.g., led light of the port for a laptop cooler is not turned on.) Data transfer speed is very close to the original speed when i put the USB to my macbook. Cons Power adapter is little big than what i thought.
customer_reviews.author: ShareAll

customer_reviews.title: usb drives do not stay connected
customer_reviews.text: constant disconnects when trying to access any external hdd, thinking it must be a power draw issue. the constant 'ding' from windows as the hub connects and disconnects can drive you insane as you spend an hour troubleshooting. did the usual, turned off power saving mode on each usb port through device manager, checked for updated drivers. as long as i dont try to use external hdd's no problem. finally dug out an older self powered hub that i had used before, tested the same setup, two wd passport external hdd's, keyboard, mouse, laptop cooling pad and finally plugged in the iphone for charging and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: ExInferis

customer_reviews.title: and the worst. I waited a couple of months after purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: Most expensive USB hub I ever purchased, and the worst. I waited a couple of months after purchase to use it and when I finally used it to charge 3 devices (ipad, iphone, and Samsung Galaxy S6), the next morning the power brick had died. Shame because my last $12 USB powered hub lasted 1 year instead of 1 night. It has good reviews, so maybe I just got unlucky with a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: SciFi-Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great for external 2.5 drives
customer_reviews.text: So far, this hub is great for external 2.5 drives. First, I do NOT use this for charging devices. So, skip this review if you are looking for a review about charging ability. I was looking for a powered USB 3.0 hub for multiple 2.5 HDDs. I have three attached (4TB, 3TB and 3TB) and there is no issue with power or speed degradation. I have the feeling I can likely attach 4 2.5 drives but I haven't tried yet. If you are looking to power multiple 2.5 drives, this hub is perfect.

customer_reviews.text: USB devices connected to the hub are repeatedly disconnecting and reconnecting from the computer. customer_reviews.title: An excellent surge protected ten port USB Hub!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several other Powered USB 3 hubs with varying degrees of success. The other powered hubs that I have used would randomly not allow access to attached drives or would randomly disconnect a drive or two. Upon getting this Anker powered hub, I immediately unpacked it and attached 6 different drives to it. I then accessed these drives to copy files, make backups, etc for several hours. All with none of the problems with previous hubs that I had experienced. A feature that I did not realize that this hub had is that the hub is surge protected! A very nice, and unexpected, feature. This is a recommended powered USB 3 hub on Livewire.
customer_reviews.author: Davidby

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with the Anker 10 port 60 w data hub
customer_reviews.text: I was running out of USB Ports on my Mac Mini -- a Tactile Pro Keyboard that used two ports, a USB mouse, a USB CD Rom, and 3 USB Hard drives. But this hub handles them all and allows me to wake the computer with my mouse or keyboard. That did not work when I plugged them into my aging newer technology external hard drive. When I restart the computer all the drives get mounted properly. So all in all very happy with this purchase. I didn't rate for durability because I have only had the hub for a week. Anker has become one of my go-to brands for electronic items.
customer_reviews.author: Leon
